data.title: Universitas 'Aisyiyah Yogyakarta
data.text:
Badan Eksekutif Mahasiswa Fakultas Sains dan Teknologi (BEM FST) held an Ormawa Digitalization Workshop with the theme “Towards Digital Society 5.0”. This activity was held on Sunday, August 20, 2023, at 08.00-15.15 WIB and took place in Room 4.14 Siti Moendjijah Building, Universitas ‘Aisyiyah Yogyakarta.

The purpose of the Ormawa Digitalization Workshop itself is to form an Ormawa that is open to technological developments as well as socialization and workshops on what platforms can facilitate organizations in coordination. Successful coordination will ensure the successful implementation of work or the achievement of organizational goals in daily activities or whatever it is. If coordination patterns are good, team goals will be more likely to be achieved.

This activity was carried out offline and to make the Ormawa Digitalization Workshop a success, BEM FST invited a resource person from Domainesia, namely Mr. Budi Hutomo as Marketing Manager at Domainesia. He delivered material on “Digital Society for ORMAWA”, which discusses digitalization which is the transformation of business processes, activities, and operations through the application of digital technology. The benefits of digital technology (digitalization) in managing an organization and society and several digital tools that can be used to help manage organizations such as Trello and Notion for project and task management, then for marketing and promotion there is Domainesia’s Mailspace and Hootsuite, in the graphic design section there are Canva and Figma, and many more. Participants who were representatives of various Ormawa were very enthusiastic about the presentation given. They got a lot of information and new knowledge to carry out their activities in the organization.

Participants also took advantage of the question and answer session by giving interesting questions to the speakers. The second session of this event was a workshop session on digital platforms for organizational management. This session contained training and implementation of 4 digital platforms guided by mentors from Information Technology students of Universitas ‘Aisyiyah Yogyakarta, namely WordPress by Al Bukhari Bin Riedho, Trello by Pandunanda Primadifani Kafah, Figma by Annas Abdulloh, and Mailchimp by Naufal Cahyo. The participants were asked to practice using the platform according to what had been delivered by the mentors. The training session went smoothly and the participants could follow well with the hope that it could be conveyed to other ORMAWA members represented by the participants, so that ORMAWA could take advantage of technological developments in organizational coordination.

Every November 10, the Republic of Indonesia commemorates National Heroes’ Day. Through Presidential Decree No. 316 of 1959, dated December 16, 1959, November 10, 1945 was designated as Heroes’ Day. On November 10, 1945, all government agencies held a ceremony to commemorate Heroes’ Day.

Muhammadiyah, an Islamic organization established on November 18, 1912 in Yogyakarta, has played a major role in the development of education, social, and welfare of Indonesian society. Several Muhammadiyah figures and cadres have been recognized as Indonesian National Heroes for their contributions in the struggle for independence and state development. Muhammadiyah has an important role for the Republic of Indonesia and gave birth to cadres who became important figures in the Indonesian nation’s struggle for independence, including the father of the Republic, Ir Soekarno to the charismatic scholar Buya Hamka, were Muhammadiyah cadres. Likewise, KH Ahmad Dahlan and Nyai Walidah Dahlan were appointed national heroes for helping to generate Islamic renewal, the women’s movement, and national education through the Muhammadiyah and ‘Aisyiyah organizations.

Here are some Muhammadiyah figures who were appointed as national heroes:

KH Ahmad Dahlan, founder of Muhammadiyah. Born in Yogyakarta, August 1, 1968. KH Ahmad Dahlan was named a National Hero in 1961 based on Presidential Decree No.657 in 1961.

Siti Walidah, founder of the Aisyiyah women’s movement. She was named a National Hero on November 10, 1971 in accordance with Presidential Decree Number 42/TK.

Fatmawati Soekarno, the first lady who also sewed the Saka Merah Putih. Appointed a National Hero based on Presidential Decree Number 118/TK/200 on November 4, 2000.

Ir Soekarno, the First President of the Republic of Indonesia. He became a member and a figure who loved Muhammadiyah.

General Soedirman, TNI Commander who was active in the Muhammadiyah organization.

Ir Djoeanda, Prime Minister and Minister of Finance in the early republic. He was named a National Hero and was active in Muhammadiyah.

KH Fachrudin, a cleric who received the title of National Hero based on Presidential Decree no.16 of 1964.

Buya Hamka, known as a scholar, philosopher, and writer. He is a National Hero and a guerrilla during the revolutionary period. He is a respected scholar and was active in Muhammadiyah until the end of his life.

Gatot Mangkoepradja, founder of the voluntary defense force PETA.

KH Mas Mansoer was both a scholar and a statesman. He was a member of the Badan Pengurus Usaha Persiapan Kemerdekaan Indonesia (BPUPKI).

Ki Bagus Hadikoesoemo, member of BPUPKI and the Panitia Persiapan Kemerdekaan Indonesia (PPKI).

Kasman Singodimedjo, Chairman of the Central Indonesian National Committee (the forerunner of the DPR), member of BPUPKI and PPKI. He was also the Attorney General of Indonesia during the revolutionary era. In November 2018, he received the title of National Hero from the government in the era of President Jokowi.

Abdul Kahar Muzakkir, Member of Committee of Nine & participated in formulating Pancasila

We thank the heroes who have made great contributions in building the Indonesian nation. They have fought hard for independence, justice, education, and education.

300 students of Universitas `Aisyiyah Yogyakarta from various study programs attended the Talkshow event themed “Yang Muda, Yang Berwirausaha”, presenting 3 speakers Mr. Septo Soepriyatno, – Director of Trade Business Development Ministry of Trade, Ridho Nurul Adityawan, – CEO & Founder Ayam Gepuk Pak Gembus and Ulysses Sitompul – Entrepreneurship Motivator, Monday (06/11).

This Lecture Series event is an important momentum for UNISA Jogja students to get new inspiration and enthusiasm in developing entrepreneurship. With the support of the Ministry of Trade and the entrepreneurial spirit instilled by Minister Zulkifli Hasan, it is hoped that UNISA Jogja students will be able to become young entrepreneurs, contribute to Indonesia’s economic progress, and achieve success in the business world.

“We are very pleased to be able to collaborate with the Ministry of Trade of the Republic of Indonesia and present competent speakers at this event. This Lecture Series is a form of Unisa Yogyakarta’s commitment in supporting the development of entrepreneurship in Indonesia,” said Warsiti.

Septo Soepriyatno, Director of Trade Business Development at the Ministry of Trade of the Republic of Indonesia, was one of the main speakers at this event. He explained the role of the Ministry of Trade in supporting and facilitating the development of the trade and industry sector in Indonesia. He also shared the government’s strategy in helping local entrepreneurs to compete in the global market.

Ridho Nurul Adityawan, CEO & Founder of Ayam Gepuk Pak Gembus, also provided valuable insights about doing business in the culinary sector. Ayam Gepuk Pak Gembus is a franchise that has successfully presented Indonesian culinary specialties with authentic flavors. Ridho shared his personal experience in developing a culinary business from scratch to become one of the most prominent franchises in Indonesia. Ulysses Sitompul, a well-known entrepreneurial motivator, also attended the event. He provided motivation and strategies to the students on how to embark on an entrepreneurial journey with passion and determination.

Universitas `Aisyiyah (UNISA) Yogyakarta, in collaboration with the Ministry of Trade of the Republic of Indonesia, held a Lecture Series with the theme “Yang Muda Yang Berirausaha” at Baroroh Baried hall, Monday (06/11). The event presented the Minister of Trade of the Republic of Indonesia, Dr. (HC) H. Zulkifli Hasan, S.E., M.M, as the keynote speaker.

In her opening remarks, UNISA Jogja Rector Dr. Warsiti, S.Kp., M.Kep., Sp.Mat, said that this activity is part of UNISA Jogja’s contribution in making and creating students as successful entrepreneurs.

“UNISA is ready to support the Ministry of Trade’s program in developing young businesses and creating young entrepreneurs, so that UNISA Jogja students are ready to become young entrepreneurs who are competitive in the business world,” said Warsiti.

Minister of Trade, Zulkifli Hasan, inspired the students by saying that knowledgeable and educated people are the key to the progress of a nation and civilization. Indonesia has great potential to become a developed and superior country, with all its natural resources. To achieve this, Zulkifli encouraged students to set clear goals during college and make it a motivation to strive to be the best.

“Failure is just as important as success. Failure is not the end of the world, but a stepping stone to greater success,” said Zulkifli.

Zulkifli hopes that this lecture series can motivate UNISA Jogja students to take risks, learn from failures, and continue to strive to achieve their entrepreneurial goals. In the event that was attended by 300 students, a talk show was also held to inspire them by presenting speakers Mr. Septo Soepriyatno, – Director of Trade Business Development of the Ministry of Trade, Ridho Nurul Adityawan, – CEO & Founder of Ayam Gepuk Pak Gembus and Ulysses Sitompul – Entrepreneurship Motivator.

154 7th semester students of the Medical Laboratory Technology (TLM) Study Program at the Faculty of Health Sciences of University Aisyiyah (UNISA) Yogyakarta participated in the Field Work Practice (PKL) pledge event. The event was held in Baroroh Baried Hall and attended by students, lecturers, and leaders of the PATELKI Yogyakarta region, Saturday (04/11).

Isnin Aulia Ulfah Mu’awanah, S.Si., M.Sc., Head of TLM Study Program, in her speech said that PKL is a valuable opportunity for students to apply the knowledge they have gained during lectures, students will be in the field of practice at health centers and hospitals throughout the Special Region of Yogyakarta (DIY). This PKL will last for 10 weeks and is an important platform in preparation for OSCE (Objective Structured Clinical Examination).

“I want to remind students to always communicate if there are obstacles faced during the PKL trip. Students are expected to use social media wisely and not forget the work time that has been set,” said Isnin.

M. Ali Imron, M.Fis., Dean of Fakultas Ilmu Kesehatan (FIKes) UNISA Yogyakarta, also gave a message to the students. Imron hoped that TLM graduates will become individuals who are truly beneficial to themselves and the wider community, and emphasized the importance of utilizing time well, because time is a gift given by Allah SWT to all of us.

Imron also added an important message that seeking knowledge requires obedience to teachers and clinical educators.

“The knowledge we gain comes from their willingness to teach. Therefore, students are expected to undergo this PKL with enthusiasm, dedication, and respect for the mentors,” said Imron. This PKL is expected to be a valuable experience for UNISA Jogja TLM students in developing their skills and knowledge in the world of medical laboratories, so that they can become qualified and useful medical personnel in society.

The Head of Public Relations Bureau of Universitas ‘Aisyiyah (UNISA) Yogyakarta won an award at the 2023 Indonesian PR Jamboree. Sinta Maharani, M.I.Kom., won the Silver Winner Insan PR Indonesia 2023 award in the category of universities / institutions sub-category of bureau heads, confirming her position as one of the best public relations practitioners in Indonesia. This award was received at The Rich Hotel Jogja, last Friday (27/10).

Jamboree PR Indonesia 2023 is a prestigious event held annually to appreciate and recognize the contributions of public relations practitioners throughout Indonesia. This award is considered as one of the barometers of competence and performance of public relations practitioners, as well as an indication of achievement in advancing public relations in Indonesia. Aspects of assessment include management of issues and public opinion, evaluation of the 2022/2023 public relations program and management of public relations teams & staff. The selection process was carried out last August 2023 and presentation / exposure before the judges.

Sinta Maharani, who has long been dedicated to public relations and protocol, has demonstrated her commitment and expertise in advancing UNISA Yogyakarta’s image. She successfully combines creativity, innovation and professionalism in every campaign she initiates to strengthen UNISA Yogyakarta’s relationship with the community and other stakeholders.

Sinta Maharani feels very grateful for the award she received. She hopes her achievement can inspire young people who are interested in a career as public relations. “This award is the result of hard work by the UNISA Public Relations and Protocol team. We will continue to be committed to maintaining the quality of communication and relationships with all parties so that UNISA remains a trusted university and contributes positively to society,” said Sinta The Insan PR Indonesia 2023 Silver Winner Award achieved by Sinta Maharani is an achievement that strengthens UNISA Yogyakarta’s position as one of the leading universities in the field of public relations and protocol in Indonesia. UNISA hopes that this achievement will encourage further development in the discipline of public relations and provide greater benefits to society and the world of education.
